descriptor.name: Swachh Bharat Mission - Urban (IHHL) Application Guide
descriptor.short_desc: A course on how to assist urban households in applying for financial aid for individual toilet construction under Swachh Bharat Mission 2.0.
descriptor.long_desc:
Course Overview:
This module provides a detailed guide on the Individual Household Latrine (IHHL) component of the Swachh Bharat Mission – Urban 2.0. Agents will learn how to help urban households without access to a toilet apply for financial support to construct one, contributing to a cleaner and healthier India.

  1. Financial Support Tiers:
    Understand the different levels of financial assistance provided for toilet construction, which varies by state and Union Territory (e.g., ₹6667 in UP, ₹12,000 in Uttarakhand, ₹5333 in UTs).
  2. Eligibility for IHHL:
    Learn the eligibility criteria, focusing on any urban household that either does not have an individual toilet or uses an insanitary latrine.
  3. Online Application Steps:
    Master the online application process, from registering for a Login ID to filling in geographical details, toilet owner's particulars, and uploading necessary documents like bank details and a photograph.

Why Take This Course:

  • Play a direct role in making India's urban areas Open Defecation Free (ODF).
  • Specialize in a flagship national sanitation and public health scheme.
  • Empower urban households to improve their health and dignity by accessing government support.
